results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Fred Astaire
results.creator_credit: American Film Institute, George Stevens Jr and Marty Pasetta
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped to shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. Fred Astaire whose career as a dancer, actor and singer is honoured here with the AFI’s Lifetime Achievement Award after a career of more than 77 years and a screen career of more than 40 films. This remarkable and versatile actor whose reputation was established in the films made with actress and long-time dance partner Ginger Rogers is joined by his colleagues in a celebration of his contribution to film including excerpts from the films, ‘The Gay divorcee’, ‘Top hat’, ‘Funny face’, ‘Swingtime’, ‘On the beach’, ‘Finian’s rainbow’ and ‘The Towering inferno’ to name a few. David Niven hosts the event with speaking guests including: Mikhail Barishnikov, Cyd Charisse, Barrie Chase, Bob Fosse, Audrey Hepburn, Charlton Heston, Gene Kelly, Hermes Pam, Eleanor Powell and Leslie Caron.

results.title: The American Film Institute salute to Bette Davis
results.creator_credit: American Film Institute and Robert Scheerer
results.brief_description: This series from the American Film Institute (AFI) salutes some of the biggest stars that helped shape the face of Hollywood as we know it today. Bette Davis acted in over eighty films during her film career. Her superior and uncompromising representation of characters are as vivid and challenging to view today as they were when made. Her portrayal of women as a powerful force is recognised here as adding significantly to the portrayal of women in film. To celebrate the life and work of Bette Davis, actress Jane Fonda presents with the AFI a salute to Davis’s career with footage from over forty of her films and introductions from some of Davis’s celebrated colleagues: Peter Faulk, Olivier d’Havilland, Geraldine Fitzgerald, Henry Fonda, Lee Grant, Paul Henry, Liza Minelli, Robert Wagner, George Stevens Jr., Natalie Wood, Cicely Tyson and William Wyler.

results.title: The Ambassadors symphony
results.brief_description: Provides a non-narrated overview of the 1984 Australian Youth Orchestra tour in Europe. Conveys an impression of the impact of this tour on European audiences.

results.title: The Amazon: life along the river in Peru
results.brief_description: Following the Amazon River to its sources in the High Andes of Peru, this film surveys the geography of the Maranon river area and the peoples way of life and variation in climate and vegetation on the western and eastern slopes and in the foothills of the Andes. Also shown is the city of Iquitos - the trade centre of the Upper Andes and its environs, the abundantly productive rainforests No other credits available.

results.title: The Amazon awakens
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Inter-American Affairs
results.brief_description: The story of the Amazon River Basin; its history and exploration by early Spanish explorers; its industrial progress; the natural resources and vast riches of this region still awaiting discovery and exploitation.

results.title: The Amazing newborn
results.creator_credit: Maureen Hack and Patricia E Rambasek
results.brief_description: Shows how normal infants aged 1-7 days can see and have visual preferences, turn their heads in response to spoken words, mimic and move in rhythm to parental voices. It also shows the six states of consciousness first observed by Peter Wolff.

results.title: The Amazing laser
results.creator_credit: London Television Service, Richard Reisz and Eddie Newstead
results.brief_description: The laser has applications in many fields, from entertainment to scientific research. Looks at some of the ways in which lasers are being used, and possible future development with lasers. It is being used in the printing industry for etching copper plates, in the search for cheap energy by producing fusion reactions in the laboratory, as a scalpel in surgery, and for making holograms. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.creator_credit: Yellow Ball Workshop and Dominic Falcone

results.title: The Amazing Bone (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Michael Sporn Animation and Michael Sporn
results.brief_description: Pearl the pig finds a magic talking bone. On the way home the bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fair as well with a debonair fox. Although Pearl and the talking bone so live happily ever after.

results.title: The Amazing bone
results.brief_description: Pearl, a lively young pig, touched by spring, happens upon a talking bone that belonged to a witch. The bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fare as well with the debonair fox. From a book by William Steig.
